Job Description:
At Regions, the Cloud DevSecOps Engineer contributes to the advancement of cloud strategy. The primary focus of this role includes developing, communicating, and implementing robust and secure cloud continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines. This role works closely with stakeholders to create fully automated pipelines which support current DevSecOps best practices.

Primary Responsibilities
Partners with other engineers and information technology staff to orchestrate code builds, quality and security analyses, deployments, and automated testing through CI/CD release candidacy pipelines
Articulates business needs and translate them into technology solutions
Models release candidate CI/CD pipelines as a mechanism to communicate the states and steps necessary to determine a release candidate for each application and service
Designs and develops fully autonomous CI/CD pipelines which facilitate cloud deployments which includes automation of all infrastructure, services and application build and deployment
Ensures that all parts of the pipeline follow good software engineering practices to include automated tests and infrastructure tests
Researches new technologies that will improve efficiency and effectiveness
Implements highly scalable CI/CD platforms to support high change volumes and fast feedback
Completes project work and contributes to the technical direction of various objectives
Automates operational activities and tasks
Responds to performance issues identified by alerts and reported incidents related to CI/CD platforms
Builds tools which reduce errors and improve our overall customer experiences
Assists in troubleshooting of production issues and ensure pipeline and infrastructure produces clear documentation and metrics which enables Root Cause Analysis
Develops and tests – Ansible Playbooks, Terraform Scripts, Packer Scripts and establish immutable infrastructure such that patches are an artifact of the past
Works with Enterprise Architecture, Information Security (InfoSec), Software Delivery, and Quality Assurance to enable the organization to move to the cloud using complete automation
Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience

This position is exempt from timekeeping requirements under the Fair Labor Standards Act and is not eligible for overtime pay.

This position is incentive eligible.

Requirements
High School Diploma or GED and ten (10) years of related post-secondary education and/or experience in Information Security or Information Technology

Preferences
Six (6) years of relevant DevSecOps experience
AWS DevOps certification or Azure DevOps certification
Experience in building / deploying cloud native applications – OpenShift, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
Experience in observing real-time metrics in the pipeline and deployment strategies – Blue/Green, Canary Deployment
Experience with either AWS or Azure cloud technologies
Experience with interfacing with secrets management solutions like Hashicorp Vault
Familiar with implementing Chaos engineering principles in the pipeline to determine weak links and suggest solutions.
Familiar with testing tools used to facilitate automation and integration of the tools into CI/CD pipelines
Must be comfortable in developing pipelines as code using yaml specs, ansible playbooks

Skills and Competencies
Excellent communication skills and willing to mentor developers and other team members in the art of DevSecOps
Excellent knowledge of Cloud infrastructure, networking, services, and cloud architectural patterns; specifically, compute using virtual machines, managed infrastructure, containers, serverless, as well as database services, security services, and application services
Proficient in python programming language
Understanding of Shift Left principles and facilitation technologies
Working Knowledge of Jenkins, Azure DevOps, Ansible, Terraform, Packer, Git, ServiceNow a big plus

Position Type Full time

Position Description
Raytheon Intelligence & Space (RI&S) / Cybersecurity, Intelligence and Services (CIS) Mission Area / Cyber Offense and Defense EXperts (CODEX) Digital Technology (CODEX DT) is seeking talented DevOps engineers to assist our team with operating, developing, and improving a Network and Server/Application infrastructure environment within AWS GovCloud. We are seeking DevOps engineers with experience working in a rapidly-changing and fast paced environment working with over 20 different applications. Our team provisions and administers services and applications hosted among three distinct networks, each with its own data protection requirements, connectivity, and support model. We also support connectivity for the networks in each of the 12+ geographically disparate CODEX sites in addition to remote work from home (WFH).
Use and develop scripts using Ansible roles, Terraform modules, Packer, Jenkins CI/CD pipelines, and Ansible Tower to provision and configure servers, services, applications, and security
Setup and maintain applications in AWS GovCloud, utilizing Dev/Production environments
Setup and maintain local site applications on VMware ESXi servers, utilizing connectivity with AWS applications to extend service availability and provide local access
Configure and manage networking equipment to enable intra- and inter-site connectivity, including Extreme switches, Forcepoint firewalls, Cisco wireless access points
Lead technical projects, working with team members and inter-departmental groups to plan, execute, and deliver new features or capabilities
Follow best practices for disaster recovery/business continuity in server, network, and security design
Manage Linux and Windows servers, following best practices for logging, monitoring, and system maintenance
Provide expertise and support for IT Operational management of security monitoring, compliance, and auditing tools


Required Skills and Experience
8 Years of Experience in IT (Operations, Security, or Development), or DevOps
4+ Years of experience with Linux System Administration
Familiar with Windows System Administration
1+ Years of experience with networking (TCP/IP, switching, routers, firewalls, etc)
2+ Years of experience running services within AWS or another cloud provider (Azure, etc)
Architecting new services using AWS resources
Troubleshooting resources (Load balancers, Autoscaling groups, security groups)
2 Years of experience running services within VMware ESXi virtual machines
Familiarity with automation and configuration management tools to manage and deploy servers and applications (Ansible, Terraform, Packer, Puppet, Chef, Python, Bash, Powershell, etc)
Familiarity with source code management of any code/scripts/documentation used for automation
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong sense of accountability to meet work deadlines and support sprint goals
Must be a U.S Citizen
Desired Skills and Experiences
Experience developing automated solutions utilizing Ansible, Terraform, docker-compose, and Helm
Experience working with containerized applications using Docker and/or Kubernetes
Experience administering any/all of the following applications - Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, RocketChat, PexIP, Panzura, Exchange, Forcepoint SMC/NGFW, Hashicorp Vault
Experience developing CI/CD pipelines for delivery and testing of services/applications
Experience within AWS GovCloud or Raytheon MissionCloud
Professional Certifications such as: AWS Solutions Architect, AWS Developer, Linux+, Security+, CCNA
Required Education
Bachelor of Science Degree in a related engineering field and 8 years of related experience; OR 4 additional years of Engineering, Computer or Information Science applicable professional experience in lieu of degree.
The salary range for this role is 94,000 USD - 196,000 USD; however, RTX considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role and associated responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, location, education/training, and key skills. Hired applicants may be eligible for benefits, including but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, flexible work schedules, employee assistance program, Employee Scholar Program, parental leave, paid time off, and holidays. Cloud DevOps Engineer – Tier 3
NIKSUN is the recognized worldwide leader in making the Unknown Known, by using next-generation technology that revolutionizes the way networks and services are secured, protected, and managed. The company develops and deploys a complete range of award-winning forensics, compliance, security surveillance, and performance management solutions for applications ranging from core infrastructures to edge and branch environments.
Responsibilities
Respond to customer incidents by conducting preliminary assessments to product or system issues. Debug problems and track until resolution by analyzing the source of the issue and its impact on hardware, network, and storage resources. With your technical expertise, you will support cloud solutions, App installs, release updates & upgrades, testing, deploying, and maintaining and enhancing software solutions. You will address bugs and escalate to engineering, check code in, and verify accuracy, testability, functionality, and efficiency. Also, you should have a good understanding of different hardware components: processing, networking, storage. NIKSUN Cloud Support Engineer is a customer facing role in which you:
Support and implement scalable and reliable software deployment pipelines.
Ensure that software apps in cloud operate seamlessly and are well maintained for NIKSUN customers.
Troubleshoot software deployment and release issues and implement fixes/ work arounds.
Lead, manage, and drive incidents to resolution adhering to severity standards, escalating unresolved problems to next engineering level at appropriate time.
Run full problem management activities monthly for all incidents.
Build and maintain Knowledge Article database, documenting incident root-causes and potential fixes.
NIKSUN Cloud Support operates 24x7x365, as such you will be working on a shift schedule which may include a rotation of days, nights, weekends, and holidays.
Requirements
Must have 3 to 5 years of experience in DevOps tools (Jenkins, Git, Docker, Kubernetes and Ansible).
Must have 3 years of experience testing, maintaining and/or launching software products.
Must have 3 years of experience in cloud computing (Kubernetes and Docker).
Must have 3 years of experience in UNIX and networking.
Must have 2 years of experience in Database and SQL.
Required Skills and traits.
Motivated self-starter.
Good written and oral communication skills.
NIKSUN encourages teamwork, collaboration, and knowledge sharing.
Mentor other team members and push the team for success.
Professional Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or equivalent software engineering discipline.

Company Description

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.
When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.
Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

Visa Inc is looking for a dynamic individual to join our team as a Staff SW Release Engineer. As a member of the Release Engineering team in our US foster city office, the Staff SW Release Engineer will be ensuring availability of CI/CD systems and automation tooling across PPT for various type of binaries including VMs & containers. The team maintains the build/deploy systems and owns related processes to ensure high quality of delivery standards for a large landscape of digital payment applications.

The Staff SW Release Engineer will handle the daily responsibilities of supporting the release/DevOps needs of Application development teams. These tasks include configuration identification, change management, build, deploy and release artifact management, version control, and source code auditing/reporting, environment support and troubleshooting.

The Staff SW Release Engineer will have working relationships with multiple teams, providing assistance through the development cycle for any required changes to the build/release/deploy processes required to get a product certified into integration environments through the release into production environments.

Cross-functional team collaboration and effective communications skills are essential.

Essential Functions:

Key responsibilities include:
Build & Support Container CI/CD pipeline for build, deploy and release requirements.
Assist in scheduling and implementing changes to the build / release / version-control processes required to enforce and apply release engineering best practices
Provide guidance to cross-team and team members in release best practices and procedures
Support all pre-production, integration environments for middleware services and applications
Work with cross functional, geographically distributed teams to provide 24X7 support across multiple non-production environments.
Responsible for continuous delivery pipeline for build & deployment for containers.
Responsible for working with Security, Operations, Development, testing team and other teams to understand changes to the existing production environment on an ongoing basis and for non-prod environment support.
Preserve and maintain service availability, performance, integrity, capacity and security.
Maintain and suggest improvements to deployment scripts and tooling
Participate in the decision making of success or failure of applications systems to be deployed in production
Update documentation that communicates standards and best practices.
Implement metrics, monitoring & Key Performance Indicators.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:
Master's degree in Math, Science, Engineering, or Computer Science, Information Systems or related field AND minimum three (3) years of experience in a directly related field. OR
Bachelor's degree in Math, Science, Engineering, or Computer Science, Information Systems or related field AND minimum five (5) years of experience in a directly related field. OR
Minimum eight (8) years of directly related experience.

Preferred Qualifications:
9 + years of Industry experience with 4+ years of experience in DevOps, CI/CD , Release with automation Experience.
Solid Experience or certification with Containers technologies, Kubernetes, Docker EE & OpenShift to build/enhance seamless CI/CD pipeline.
Build and troubleshoot build issues in Java applications.
DevOps Acumen to build better solutions to bring operation excellence in Build/deploy pipelines for VM and Containers.
Linux, Unix and Shell Scripting, and Automation
Experience with one scripting or programming language (Python, bash)
Advance knowledge and experience with Linux and UNIX,
Experience with monitoring tools SPLUNK, or any other monitoring tools/processes.
Strong Experience with RDBMS Database technology like Oracle, MySQL, Liquibase.
Experience with SCM tools -GIT (Bitbucket) and Artifactory
CI tool management - Jenkins, both in setup and support is required.
Experience with Project Management tools (Jira)
Demonstrated ability to work with distributed teams.

Additional Information

Work Hours: Varies upon the needs of the department.
Travel Requirements: This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.
Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.
Visa is an EEO Employer. Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity. Implement and manage virtualization solutions using VMware
Configure and troubleshoot OpenVPN across Linux environments for secure data transfer

Provide technical support for both hardware and software issues that arise

Experience with OpenVPN configuration and troubleshooting

Experience with cloud services and migrations

CCNA (R/S) and CCNP is required

#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role:
We are seeking a highly experienced and skilled Senior Cloud Software Engineer/DevOps Engineer to join our team. As a Senior Cloud Software Engineer/DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing our complex IT-Operations infrastructure and application stack, and driving the adoption of DevOps practices within our organization.
Lead the design, implementation, and management of scalable and highly available hybrid cloud infrastructure using industry best practices.
Develop and maintain robust CI/CD pipelines to automate the deployment, testing, and monitoring of hybrid cloud-based applications.
Optimize the performance, security, and cost-efficiency of our cloud infrastructure through continuous monitoring, analysis, and improvement.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex issues related to cloud infrastructure and applications.
Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends, and evaluate their potential impact on our cloud infrastructure and DevOps practices.
Mentor and coach junior team members, providing guidance and support to help them enhance their skills and knowledge.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define and implement DevOps processes and best practices across the organization.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
8-11 years of experience working as a Cloud Software Engineer/DevOps Engineer or in a similar role.
Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Proficiency in infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation.
Strong scripting and programming skills in languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
Expertise in containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
In-depth understanding of networking concepts, protocols, and security best practices.
Strong Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as Grafana, DataDog or similar.
Proven track record of successfully managing and optimizing large-scale cloud infrastructure.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle complex technical challenges.
Excellent communication, leadership, and collaboration skills.
Bonus Points:
Certification in AWS, Azure, or GCP (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Azure DevOps Engineer Expert).
Extensive experience with serverless computing and microservices architecture.
Proficiency in configuration management tools such as Ansible or Chef.
Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and experience leading Agile teams.

Department: Technology

Our Company Promise

All of Southwest’s People come together to deliver on our Purpose; Connecting People to what’s important in their lives through friendly, reliable, and low-cost air travel. The Senior Cloud DevOps Engineer is a specialized role in the Cloud Security Acceleration Team that delivers on our Purpose by rapidly improving and o ptimizing S outhwest ’ s cloud security posture and practices . Southwest Airlines is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We continue to look for opportunities to reflect the communities we serve, and welcome applicants with diverse thoughts, backgrounds, and experiences.

Job Summary

Focus on designing and building enterprise cloud infrastructure automation, pipelines, and cloud capabilities for services on AWS. Partner with application, security, and architecture teams to build re-usable and secure cloud infrastructure to be used by business applications. Operate in a DevOps culture and team, responsible for architecture, design, development, implementation, and ongoing operations of new and emerging technology platforms.

Responsibilities

Evaluate cloud services and architecture to identify strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems

Implement automation tools and frameworks for automatic code deployment (CI/CD)

Work with the development team to deploy and manage tools that support SDLC automation, configuration management, and release management

Understand technical architectures with automation to support complex delivery across a wide range of digital and enterprise applications

Lead the design, development, and evolution of cloud infrastructure

Establish and/or follow procedures and standards to ensure high quality and quantity of work

Establish or follow prioritization processes to drive work with a sense of urgency about getting work completed

Consult with stakeholders to specify requirements and solutions which address business challenges and opportunities

Serve as a subject matter expert in cloud infrastructure, performing design reviews and consulting with your teams to ensure design best practices

Maintain business continuity and disaster recovery processes

May perform other job duties as directed by Employee's Leaders

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Knowledge of AWS Infrastructure as a Service Automation tools like Cloud Formation

Ability to understand AWS compute, data sources, security technologies

Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code (IAC)

The Azure Core Linux team's mission is to empower every Linux developer and operator to innovate and run secure, reliable, services at scale. We are looking for an experienced Senior Linux Software Engineer to help make Azure the best place to run Linux workloads.

The Azure Core Linux team is responsible for packages.microsoft.com (where Linux users download Microsoft software like SQL, .NET, edge, etc.), Linux Provisioning and Supportability (improving the performance an reliability of booting Linux on Azure), the Azure Serial Console and Cloud Shell services, Upstream Community Engineering (Debian, Fedora, Flatcar Linux, pulp-packaging, Rust, etc.).

As a Senior Linux Software Engineer on the Azure Core Linux team, you will improve the Linux and cloud native experience on Azure by developing and operating new and existing production services at scale, improve the performance and reliability of existing cloud infrastructure, and work with internal and external partners to create a seamless Linux experience on Azure. This includes working with developing and maintaining our Linux repositories (packages.microsoft.com) and contributing to upstream Linux and Open Source projects (Fedora, Debian, etc.).

If you are passionate about Linux, we enable customers to troubleshoot their Linux workloads, Microsoft partner teams to package and publish their Linux software, and customers to provision their Azure compute resources. We also offer the opportunity to contribute upstream on Open Source projects that our customers and services use.

Microsoft Loves Linux and Open Source, come join us if you do too.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond. #azurecorejobs

Responsibilities
Collaborates with appropriate stakeholders to determine user requirements for a scenario.
Drives identification of dependencies and the development of design documents for a product, application, service, or platform.
Creates, implements, optimizes, debugs, refactors, and reuses code to establish and improve performance and maintainability, effectiveness, and return on investment (ROI).
Leverages subject-matter expertise of product features and partners with appropriate stakeholders (e.g., project managers) to drive a workgroup's project plans, release plans, and work items.
Architecting, designing, building, deploying, and iterating solutions, like packages.microsoft.com, to improve the Linux and cloud native experience on Azure, work in upstream projects like Debian, Fedora, Flatcar, pulp-packaging, etc. Work with internal teams to improve the Azure CLI and extensions experience for Linux users. Work with appropriate stakeholders to determine user requirements for a set of features.
You will also work with external partners and in the open source community to enable and improve the Linux on Azure experience.
Identify and document friction in deploying and managing various Linux distributions on Azure. Participate in investigating solutions, working with internal teams and external users to validate resolution.
Maintains operations of live service as issues arise on a rotational, on-call basis. Identifies solutions and mitigations to simple issues and complex issues when applicable impacting performance or functionality of Live Site services and escalates as necessary.
Acts as a Designated Responsible Individual (DRI) and guides other engineers by developing and following the playbook, working on call to monitor system/product/service for degradation, downtime, or interruptions, alerting stakeholders about status and initiates actions to restore system/product/service for simple and complex problems when appropriate. Troubleshooting Linux issues to root cause and fix infrastructure and boot issues (provisioning agents, cloud-init, kernel, packaging, initrd, drivers, IMDS, storage, etc.). Contribute these fixes to upstream open source projects and communities.
Help to create solutions for troubleshooting Linux issues to root cause and fix infrastructure and boot issues (provisioning agents, cloud-init, kernel, initial ramdisk (initrd), drivers, storage, etc.). Contribute these fixes to upstream open source projects and communities.
Maintains communication with key partners across the Microsoft ecosystem of engineers and with the Linux partners and communities. Considers partners across teams and their end goals for products to drive and achieve desirable user experiences and fitting the dynamic needs of partners/customers through product development.
Proactively seeks new knowledge and adapts to new trends, technical solutions, and patterns that will improve the availability, reliability, efficiency, observability, and performance of products while also driving consistency in monitoring and operations at scale.
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related technical discipline AND technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python OR equivalent experience.
Previous experience as a DevOps engineer running internet / highly scalable and reliable services / micro-services and doing production code reviews using source code control (github) for cloud services.
Previous experience developing on and for Linux (for example: kernel, early-boot, systemd, cloud-init, Kubernetes, container primitives, filesystems, building Linux packages and repos, and/or eBPF)
Other Requirements:
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:
Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

Preferred Qualifications:
Master's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field AND technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python OR equivalent experience.
Contributions to upstream open source Linux projects (Debian, Fedora, Flatcar, CentOS, etc).

BRIVITY | Powered by PLACE
About PLACE:
PLACE is an end-to-end technology and business services platform designed to simplify the real estate lifecycle for both consumers and their real estate agents. Top producing real estate teams partner with PLACE because we take care of bookkeeping, human resources, in-house legal, design and marketing, talent acquisition, business training and coaching. Consumers choose real estate teams Powered by PLACE because our partners are positioned to deliver a better experience to their valued clients.
About Brivity:
Brivity Platform is the all-in-one real estate solution that automates 50-75% of daily tasks and offers real estate professionals the leverage they need to generate more business, stay top of mind, close more deals, and deliver unparalleled service to their valued clients–all in one system[place]. Brivity is the technology suite of choice for 3,000+ of the nation's top producing real estate agents and teams, including those Powered by PLACE.


The Culture:

We often work after hours and on weekends to do upgrades and maintenance, and because of this, we value flexibility in our schedule.
We love it when team members share ideas or tools to improve the functionality or experience of the platform, so we appreciate some geekiness.

We're a remote first company, but we have a headquarters in Bellingham, WA. Some engineers work from there.
The Role:
You will be an equal member in our team and help out in our shared responsibilities, but we are looking for someone who is particularly interested in security and wants to take the lead there. Each of us takes the lead on different larger areas and rotate around every so often so no one gets too siloed.

Managing our infrastructure in AWS
Improving monitoring and alerting
Particpating in our on call rotation
Removing any security issues discovered by our scanning tool
Managing our intrusion detection software
Assisting users with our Single Sign On tool
Assisting developers in configuring their repos
Finding the source of performance issues
Refining and creating Prometheus alerts
Upgrading our Kubernetes clusters along with the many automation tools we run inside of it

While infrastructure, pipelines, and monitoring are our bigger long-term projects, we help developers daily with using the platform we have set up. So having great soft skills and patience is important. Besides the typical DORA 4 DevOps metrics, a large part of how we determine our success is whether the developers are happy using the platform.
Required Experience:

Strong shell scripting skills
Linux administration
Strong Kubernetes knowledge
Understanding package/dependency management in a variety of languages and frameworks
Complete understanding of networking in the cloud
Knowing how to use and interpret metrics + APM
A bachelor's degree in computer science
Knowledge of database monitoring
Bonus Qualification:

Some experience working as a developer before moving into DevOps
Knowledge of a variety of databases, Postgres most importantly
AWS Certified Solutions Architect
CKA Certified Kubernetes Architect

Infrastructure and Operations Engineer

The Infrastructure and Operations Support Engineer will be responsible for leading and coordinating infrastructure and business projects, ensuring that infrastructure development activities are consistent with the direction set by best practices and standards of Fiserv.

The Commerce Hub is the most powerful omnichannel platform built to deliver innovation through simple and fast integrations. With developer-friendly, flexible communication standards, unified APIs, and pre-certified integrations the Commerce Hub reduces development time and accelerates speed to market.

Coordinate performance analysis, recommendations, and improvements within the hosting infrastructure.
Provide mentoring and act as an escalation point for administrators and technicians.
Enforce adherence to architectural standards/principles, global product-specific guidelines, usability design standards, etc.
Collaborate with multiple internal teams across disparate groups to resolve client support escalations.
Collaborate with Product Management and Engineering to review software enhancements and provide design feedback.
What you will need to have:
Demonstrated ability to gather and translate Business/Technical requirements into High-level and Low-Level Design documents in close cooperation with Product and other non-technical staff.
Demonstrated ability to determine and document complex software or system functional specifications.
Hands on experience in Systems Architecture/ Application Integrations/ Application Support/ Application Deployments.
Hands on experience in UNIX & shell scripting.
Proven experience implementing web services and web service interfaces using WSDL, XSD, XML, SOAP/REST frameworks and technologies.
Experience with SDLC, Agile development and Waterfall methodologies
Proven experience with Software Configuration Managements and DEVOPS tools (GIT, Jenkins, Sonar)

Expertise in Web & Application servers including Websphere Application Server (WAS), JBoss and Apache
What would be great to have:
Experience with Cloud technologies IaaS, PaaS, AWS
Experience with Mobile Payments

Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce that reflects our world. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by law.

Please be aware of fraudulent job postings that are not affiliated with Fiserv. Fraudulent job postings may be used by cyber criminals to target your personally identifiable information and/or to steal money or financial information.

We will not hire through text message, social media, or email alone, and any interviews will be conducted in person or through a secure video call. We won’t ask you for sensitive information nor will we ask you to pay anything during the hiring process. We also won’t send you a check to cash on Fiserv’s behalf.

Description
Senior DevSecOps Engineer - 100% Remote within the Providence footprint of states (WA, OR, CA, MT, NM, TX, AK)
We are seeking an experienced Senior DevSecOps Engineer (aka Principal Software Engineer) to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for implementing and managing secure DevOps practices, ensuring the continuous integration and delivery of secure software. The Senior DevSecOps Engineer will play a crucial role in enhancing our organization's cybersecurity posture, reducing vulnerabilities, and optimizing our development and deployment pipelines.
DevSecOps Implementation: Design, implement, and maintain secure DevOps practices throughout the software development lifecycle. Collaborate with development and operations teams to integrate security controls seamlessly into CI/CD pipelines.
Collaboration: Work closely with development and operations teams to integrate platforms such as GitHub, Artifactory/XRay, ArgoCD etc. seamlessly with applications and services.
Security Automation: Develop and maintain automated security testing and vulnerability scanning processes. Implement and manage security orchestration and automation tools to streamline incident response and remediation.
Risk Management: Conduct security risk assessments and provide recommendations for mitigating risks. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to prioritize and address security vulnerabilities.
Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Implement and manage security best practices in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) deployment processes. Collaborate with infrastructure teams to ensure secure configuration and management of cloud resources.
Performance Optimization: Identify and address performance bottlenecks, ensuring optimal platform performance and responsiveness.
Incident Response: Participate in incident response activities and conduct post-incident reviews to enhance security measures. Develop and maintain incident response playbooks.
Community: Develop and execute strategies to engage and excite developers about our technologies/platforms
Providence caregivers are not simply valued – they’re invaluable. Join our team at Enterprise Information Services and thrive in our culture of patient-focused, whole-person care built on understanding, commitment, and mutual respect. Your voice matters here, because we know that to inspire and retain the best people, we must empower them.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree - Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering. Or equivalent educ/experience,
8 years Related experience; software development preferred with increasing scope and responsibilities.
Extensive experience with object-oriented programming in C#, Java, Python or equivalent.
Experience with source code control systems such as Git and how to successfully use them in across multiple teams.
Extensive SQL integration development experience with SQL/noSQL.
Extensive experience with Agile software development methodologies and tools such as Azure DevOps, TFS, and Jira.
Proven track record of working both independently and collaboratively as part of a multi-disciplined team.
Extensive experience with Azure/AWS/hybrid and other cloud technologies.
Experience designing and successfully implementing a highly complex project.
Preferred Qualifications:
7+ years of experience as Sr Developer
3+ years DevSecOps experience
2+ years Developer Community engagement

Why Join Providence?
Our best-in-class benefits are uniquely designed to support you and your family in staying well, growing professionally, and achieving financial security. We take care of you, so you can focus on delivering our Mission of caring for everyone, especially the most vulnerable in our communities.
About Providence
At Providence, our strength lies in Our Promise of “Know me, care for me, ease my way.” Working at our family of organizations means that regardless of your role, we’ll walk alongside you in your career, supporting you so you can support others. We provide best-in-class benefits and we foster an inclusive workplace where diversity is valued, and everyone is essential, heard and respected. Together, our 120,000 caregivers (all employees) serve in over 50 hospitals, over 1,000 clinics and a full range of health and social services across Alaska, California, Montana, New Mexico, Oregon, Texas and Washington. As a comprehensive health care organization, we are serving more people, advancing best practices and continuing our more than 100-year tradition of serving the poor and vulnerable.

Providence Shared Services is a service line within Providence that provides a variety of functional and system support services for our family of organizations across Alaska, California, Montana, New Mexico, Oregon, Texas and Washington. We are committed to the principle that every workforce member has the right to work in surroundings that are free from all forms of unlawful discrimination and harassment.

We value respect, appreciation, collaboration, diversity, and a shared commitment to serving our communities. We expect that all workforce members in our community will act in ways which reflect a commitment to and accountability for, racial and social justice and equality in the workplace. As such, we will maintain a workplace free of discrimination and harassment based on any applicable legally protected status. Position Summary
For decades, Samsung has been leading the charge on innovation. We see beauty in achieving excellence and our passion for change fuels our discoveries, inventions, and breakthrough technology. We believe that technology can, and should, make the world a better place, so we create new possibilities for people everywhere, push the limits of what’s possible, and constantly innovate.

At Samsung Electronics America, we take pride in the creativity and diversity of our talented people – they are at the forefront of everything we do. Their skillset and mindset drive our continued success. Only the resilient and resourceful thrive in the daily dose of unexpected at Samsung. We unapologetically push to achieve unforeseen potential in everything we do, both within the workplace and at home. We fearlessly face challenges head-on, conquer the unconquerable, and are comfortable living in the uncomfortable zone. Together we make the impossible possible. Because at Samsung, we Own the Unknown.

Are you ready to #OwnTheUnknown? Join us.

Samsung currently requires employees to be onsite Monday-Thursday with Friday being a flex day.
Role and Responsibilities
The Staff DevOps Engineer will design, build and run high quality and non-impactful deployments to power Samsung.com. We do continuous integration/deployment to dev/test environments and multiple production releases per day. This is a highly technical position that requires a broad set of technical skills that includes deployment technologies, monitoring and scripting to networking and infrastructure. Additionally, we pride ourselves on site availability as well as speed and flexibility to accommodate business requirements.
This position requires working with many new technologies and applications. If you thrive on solving hard and complex problems, then this could be a great fit for you. One day you might be in a DBA role, and the next day troubleshooting Kubernetes issues, all while building capacity plans for the next Samsung product release.
Specific responsibilities include:
Design, implement, and manage AWS cloud infrastructure, ensuring high availability and performance.
Develop and maintain infrastructure as code (IAC) using tools such as Terraform and Ansible.
Collaborate with development and operations teams to improve CI/CD pipelines and automate deployment processes.
Monitor and troubleshoot system performance, ensuring optimal resource utilization.
Implement and manage ElasticSearch clusters for log analysis and monitoring.
Administer PostgreSQL databases in a high-availability setup.
Manage Kubernetes clusters using Amazon EKS.
Ensure network configurations are robust and secure.
Continuously evaluate and implement best practices for security and compliance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve technical issues and provide technical support.
Background & Competencies Required:
Master’s/Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related technical field, and two years of experience in software/systems or related.
Minimum of 8 years of professional experience in AWS cloud engineering and DevOps practices.
Strong expertise in AWS services and technologies.
Proficiency in infrastructure as code tools, especially Terraform and Ansible.
Extensive experience with Linux system administration.
Proficiency in managing ElasticSearch clusters and RDS PostgreSQL databases.
Experience with Kubernetes and Amazon EKS.
Strong networking knowledge and experience in configuring VPCs, subnets, and security groups.
Scripting and programming skills (e.g., Python, Bash).
Familiarity with CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD).
AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer) are a plus.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
The salary range for this role is expected to be between $206,000 and $238,000. Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role.
Skills and Qualifications

At Samsung, we believe that innovation and growth are driven by an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. We aim to create a global team where everyone belongs and has equal opportunities, inspiring our talent to be their true selves. Summary:
Contribute to the enhancement, maintenance and support of the Charles River Devops framework as a senior member of the Release Engineering scrum team.
Responsibilities:
Work under minimal supervision to analyze, design, develop, test, and debug large and complex enhancements within Charles River’s Release Engineering infrastructure
Provide thought leadership in the design of the release engineering toolchain
Collaborate with team members on problem solving for issues related to the build process and infrastructure
Develop, test, debug, and implement CI CD process automation as well as keeping abreast of emerging technologies impactful to CRDs business
Implement, Monitor and Maintain all aspects of the release infrastructure
Provide informed guidance and direction in code reviews
Be available outside of normal office hours to troubleshoot and resolve critical release infrastructure issues
Support scrum teams through delivering effective solutions to challenging engineering toolchain problems
Continually identify and implement ways of improving the release process, tools and techniques at Charles River
Actively participate in the agile software development process by adhering to the CRD Scrum methodology including attending all daily standups, sprint planning, backlog grooming, and retrospectives
Participate in cross-team group activities to complete assignments
Provide mentoring to junior staff
Qualifications:
Education:
B.S. degree (or foreign education equivalent) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, and Physics or other technical course of study required. MS degree strongly preferred.
Experience:
6 to 10 years of progressively responsible professional DevOps experience preferably in a financial services product delivery setting
Expert experience with release engineering and DevOps technologies including Python, Gradle, Ansible, Kubernetes, Docker, Artifactory, Perforce, Chef, Puppet, etc.
Understanding of major cloud provider with demonstrable experience (Azure, AWS, etc)
Demonstrated problem solving abilities involving multi-tiered, high-volume build environments
Able to contribute to the design and development of software solutions to business and technical problems of high complexity
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Able to work constructively with peers in a collaborative team environment
A minimum of 5 years working with an Agile development methodology
Supervisory Responsibility:
Individual Contributor Team Lead Manager of Managers
Salary Range:
$115,000 - $182,500 Annual
The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

Description and Requirements
Role Value Proposition:
The Senior Enterprise Infrastructure Engineer is responsible for the management of large-scale global enterprise engineering and support of desktop & workplace technologies and the delivery of such technologies via virtualization solution. Engineer will provide technical support for engineering teams, vendors, operations staff, peers, business users and application developers as needed. Engineer will also be responsible for providing directional design input on various projects and architecture decisions.
Key Responsibilities:
Participate in end user computing / workplace technology solutions design, engineering, and optimization.
Contribute to the overall direction of the technology responsible for software, hardware, and resource decisions.
Capacity planning, forecasting, performance tuning and troubleshooting virtual environment hosting virtualized applications and shared virtual desktops.
Contribute towards developing roadmaps based on industry trends.
Collaborate with cross functional teams and work in a DevOps environment focused on project delivery.
Participate in the planning for enterprise desktop systems management software and architecture.
Collaborate with internal Engineering teams, vendors, and external IT groups to design and implement Global solutions to meet both global and local in-country business requirements based on Domestic Reference Architecture.
Participate and drive the evaluation and recommendation of new products.
Lead internal and external resources to pilot and develop solutions and create business cases for new innovative technologies which creates efficiencies, drives down costs, and provides stability for the Enterprise.
Play key role in the identification and resolution of complex end user computing problems (Tier 3 support) utilizing structured troubleshooting tools and techniques.
Drive currency initiatives across different tiers of the virtualization platform.
Essential Business Experience and Technical Skills:
Required:
Bachelor's degree with IT certifications.
Minimum of 7 years of experience in system administration.
Minimum of 5 years designing and implementing complex IT solutions.
Minimum of 5 years working with Citrix and Cloud.
5+ years of experience working in a Virtualization Engineering and Architecture capacity (managing large scale environments, installation, configuration, and troubleshooting) with Microsoft server and end user operating systems.
5+ years of experience working in an administrative capacity (installation, configuration, and troubleshooting) with end-user virtualization technologies including but not limited to Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops.
Expert knowledge on Citrix Virtual Apps & Desktop and Citrix Cloud.
Advance knowledge on Ivanti for Profile management and Personalization.
Advanced knowledge of Windows Server OS 2016/2019/2022 and Windows10/11 OS.
Strong knowledge of Hypervisor platform like VMware ESX.
Advance knowledge and experience with Microsoft Group Policy and user profile management.
Advanced hands-on knowledge of Citrix NetScalers and Storefront.
Knowledge of deployment tools like Chef and ability to build PowerShell scripts.
Knowledge of Active Directory including policies, LDAP, SAML, OAUTH, GPO.
Thorough understanding of building, designing, implementing, and managing IT solutions for services and/or applications.
Experience working with offshore delivery partners and third-party vendors.
Strong knowledge of Agile, DevOps and ITIL.
Preferred:
Citrix and Microsoft Azure Solution Architect Certifications.
Strong knowledge of monitoring tools like Nexthink, Systrack and Xenoss.
Strong knowledge of network, hardware and software, infrastructure and design, topologies, and protocols.
Advanced to Expert knowledge of Virtualization and dependent technologies to provide. strategic direction beyond immediately supported suite of infrastructure and software.
Ability to drive and manage projects to completion.
Strong problem solving analytical and documentation skills.
Strong presentation skills and preparation of executive PowerPoint presentations

Position Summary
The Senior DevOps Engineer is the lead engineer of the DevOps program. They are responsible for designing, developing, implementing, and managing high complexity software development. They will work on the full lifecycle of development: build, deployment, testing, and release of automated pipelines and processes.
Deliverables and Performance Measures:
Identifies, assesses, and solves complex technical problems, where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors, and applies various tool and automation solutions to drive frequent and quality solutions for an enterprise SaaS platform.
Ability to collaborate and coordinate across multiple disciplines to deliver aligned solutions meeting multiple complex needs that ultimately delivers a world-class experience to the ecosystem Insurance Technologies serves.
Designs all aspects of Continuous Delivery implementation on Hexure systems build or application support projects.
Works with developers and management to develop plans and implement delivery pipelines. Designs, documents, automates and supports CI/CD pipelines promoting code across R&D and operationally critical environments.
Develops and operates infrastructure as code, monitoring, and logging.
Work with cybersecurity to ensure secure practices and policies are woven into every aspect of operations.
Supports the development of high-quality software through automation that enables development and quality teams.
Acts independently to determine methods and procedures on new assignments.
Contributes to DevOps practice development including asset creation, and enterprise strategy.
What will make you successful:
5+ years of experience managing application development, software delivery lifecycle, and/or infrastructure development and administration.
5+ years of experience designing and implementing Continuous Delivery and/or DevOps solutions and patterns.
5+ years of experience managing code repositories, code merge and quality checks, continuous integration, and automated deployments.
3+ years of experience with Azure Administration including core PaaS services.
3+ years of experience building and managing Azure DevOps Pipelines and/or GitHub Actions
3+ years of experience with ARM, Bicep, or Terraform
3+ years of experience with scripting tools including Powershell.
3+ years of experience with Windows Server/IIS/SQL Server/.NET technology stack.
2+ years of experience with SQL or Azure SQL
Certifications Preferred: Azure DevOps Engineer, Azure Administrator, or Azure Developer
Core Competencies
Interpersonal Skills: Now more than ever, the ability to build relationships with team members and clients is pivotal to the success of our organization. We are looking for candidates who can communicate effectively and help cultivate an agile environment of collaboration and inclusion.
Personal Capabilities: We believe that the way people manage themselves and their relationships with others in the workplace is critical to the success of our organization. We are looking for candidates that effectively put their knowledge, values, and skills into practice.
Focus on Results: As a company that values innovation, we are looking for candidates who will help drive efforts to build commitment for individual and team objectives, as well as anticipate and respond to issues and opportunities that could affect the organization.
Customer Advocacy: Our purpose is to empower our clients to deliver customer-centric sales experiences, accelerate speed to market, improve in-good-order sales and meet regulatory requirements. This requires a focus on our customer‘s satisfaction. We are looking for candidates who can understand the needs and concerns of our clients and address them quickly and expertly.
Where We See This Role Going:
We are committed to being a driving force in the innovation of the insurance market and that means that we help our employees stay on top of current trends and technologies, and progress within our company. This position can move into the following roles.
DevOps Manager
About Us (Hexure)
Join a team where we encourage creativity and innovation, champion teamwork and are committed to being the best.In this environment we strive to provide our clients best-in-class solutions that transform business processes and empower sales across all insurance, retirement and investment products.

Job Description:
SitusAMC is where the best and most passionate people come to transform our client’s businesses and their own careers. Whether you’re a real estate veteran, a passionate technologist, or looking to get your start, join us as we work together to realize opportunities for everyone, we proudly serve.

At SitusAMC, we are looking to match your unique experience with one of our amazing careers, so that we can help you realize your potential and career growth within the Real Estate Industry. If you are someone who can be yourself, advocate for others, stay nimble, dream big, own every outcome, and think global but act local – come join our team!

Position Overview:
SitusAMC is on a Digital Transformation journey to implement and automate the infrastructure, platform creation through IaC integrated with Azure DevOps as the template repo. An Engineer with a passion for programming and knowledge in Cloud technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, in general and AWS specific cloud components such as EC2, EKS, AWS Lamda functions, API Gateway, RDS. Engineer/Developer is expected to provide strategy and implement an enterprise scale service mesh and side car architectures with focus on scalability, performance, security and availability.


Work independently, and with the Cloud development team, to develop and maintain automation for cloud infrastructure

Deploy critical infrastructure components through Infrastructure-as-Code tooling across multiple environments using Terraform integrated through Azure DevOps.

Support the development of compelling features using modern tools and technologies with a focus on building future-proof systems that perform at scale

Architecting and developing stateless and stateful applications using AWS cloud technologies

Provide software development knowledge with respect to cloud architecture, design patterns and programming

Establishes Cloud Infrastructure Design best practices, templates, and processes

Collaborates with external and internal partners, participate, and suggest on design, architectural decisions.

Other activities as may be assigned by your manager

Qualifications/ Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree from four-year accredited college in Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience

10 to 12 years’ experience working on automation and developmental works related to infrastructure operations preferred

Proficient in various AWS cloud components for designing and building stateful and stateless applications

Terraform expertise building IaaC

Azure DevOps knowledge is good

The employee may be required to report to a different local office as a normal, contemplated, and mandated incident of their employment

Working Conditions:
Office environment with frequent computer, mouse, keyboard use

Alternating between sitting or standing as needed

Hearing, talking, reaching, grasping

Job Description
Who Are We:
FIS connects consumers to their money through leading-edge payments solutions. We’re the development engine of FIS: the largest, Fortune 500, Fintech company in the world. Our solution is branded by our customers — banks and retailers — so you might not have heard of us. But, if you’ve used a mobile banking app, interacted with an ATM, or used a debit card to complete a financial transaction, you’re most likely using FIS software. Our product is one that touches the average consumer on a regular basis, and makes the financial world go ‘round. Headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida, FIS serves more than 20,000 clients in over 130 countries, and our technology powers billions of transactions annually that move over $9 trillion around the globe. FIS is a Fortune 500 company, ranked 392 on the Fortune 500 list and is a member of Standard & Poor’s 500® Index. Named a 2016 “World’s Most Admired Company” by Fortune Magazine.
About the Team:
FIS is looking for a DevOps DBA to join a DevOps team. The Digital One Technical Delivery team builds and delivers a new FIS solution based on microservices architecture for containerized cloud-ready infrastructure. Our development stream leverages Agile methodologies - our team’s role is to build source code and promote artifacts through to releasable status. Our focus is pipeline automation of everything – builds, tests, scans, configuration, database and deploys – with metric collection. We are looking for talented resources to be a part of this dynamic team that will grow with the growth of the solution.
What you will be doing:
Help shape and build our next gen pipeline deployment infrastructure with Database automation tools.
Implement Flyway/Liquibase database tools within a CICD pipeline.
Work closely with DevOps teammates to maintain consistent deployments between the application and database.
Work with our Configuration team and Release management – with focus on automating promotion.
Engage with Development teams to take latest version and promote release through client test environments.
Create/maintain/improve automation that builds and deploys environments for client focused testing and implementation teams.
Troubleshoot and remediate script issues.
Occasional manual running of DML scripts.
Initial provisioning and basic configuration of server from a base Oracle VM image.
Configuration of schemas and users.
Collaboration and hand off to Enterprise Production DBAs.
Metrics collection and dashboarding
Maintain Git and Artifactory repository structures
Collaborate with team to package releases with Helm charts
Advocate for best practices when it comes to DevOps processes, culture, and 12-factor application design.
What you bring:
Note - This is not a Production DBA role – A traditional DBA background is not required.
Experience building Database automation with Flyway or Liquibase tools.
Experience with CICD pipelines with promotion to multiple environments.
Experience with basic configuration of Oracle database servers
Experience with Oracle dev tools, writing and executing scripts.
Understanding of DevOps best practices.
Solid experience with Git-based source repositories.
Experience using Cloud services such as Microsoft Azure Service or AWS
Experience with container-based platforms such as Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift, AKS/EKS.
Experience using Helm as package manager for container applications.
Programming or scripting with Bash, Go, Python, and similar languages.
Experience with API based applications– test tools and concepts.
Infrastructure and networking experience.
Strong communication and organization skills to work with internal teams.
What we offer you:
A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
A modern, international work environment and a dedicated and motivated team
A competitive salary and benefits
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology
A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility and respect
Varied and challenging work to help you grow your technical skillset

Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

Team introduction
The IC-TikTok team, part of the Intelligent Creation department, is an international R&D group tasked with building creative capabilities for TikTok. We're dedicated to productizing AI and multimedia technologies to create world-class creation experiences for TikTok users. Our tech stack includes front-end, back-end, mobile, and desktop development, as well as multimedia technologies like audio/video processing and AR effects, in addtion to visual and graphic algorithms. Our team spans major cities in China(Beijing, Shanghai, Hangzhou, Shenzhen, and Guangzhou), Singapore, as well as the United States(San Jose, Seattle, and Los Angeles). Join us to craft the best creative tools with the most cutting-edge AI and multimedia technologies!
The Dev Infra Team, which supports over 300 RDs daily development environment,is your hardest work to improve productivity, happiness, and quality. The team is based in the US and CN, and our mission is to focus on the full life cycle of development, build compliance/stability and agility technical architecture for a developing ecosystem.
As a Senior Dev Infra Engineer on the IC-TikTok Dev Infra Team, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable and robust dev infra systems to support the creative tools, multimedia, effects(like game engine) used by millions of users worldwide. Your technical expertise will directly impact the engineering of cross functional teams(c++, Android, iOS, PC), and improve our product's quality.
Joining the IC-TikTok Dev Infra Team will provide you with an excellent career growth opportunity, allowing you to contribute to the enhancement of the creative experience for millions of users worldwide. If you are a skilled compilation, C++, Android/iOS, fullstack Engineer with a passion for technological innovation and content creation, we sincerely invite you to be part of our Dev Infra team. Let's collaborate to build outstanding development environments that power innovative creative tools on TikTok!

Job Description:
1. You will play a key role in implementing CI/CD pipelines, automation solutions, monitoring and logging, automated testing, and ensuring security and compliance measures are in place
2. Responsible for the development of cross-platform engineering efficiency-related products, deploy, optimization and maintenance of CI/CD related infrastructure, continuously improving and perfecting the automation process.
3. Participate in the development of operations and maintenance monitoring tools and systems, continuously optimize compilation and debugging efficiency.
4. Establish a research and development efficiency measurement system, bear the research and development process and control, support the overall technical team's efficiency transformation.
5. Response for planning of Develop Infrastructure and mentor junior engineer.
Qualifications
1. Bachelor's degree or above in computer science, software engineering, or a related field, with more than 5 years of work experience and rich practical experience in C++ compilation optimization.
2. Extensive experience in DevOps, CI/CD development, Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines with efficiency improvement experience, and experience in cross-platform SDK development. Familiarity with Android/iOS development is preferred.
3. Proficient in CMake, skilled in using Git and Jenkins, familiar with Linux commands and Shell programming.
4. Familiarity with full-stack development is preferred.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at rd.accommodations@tiktok.com

We are seeking an experienced Azure DevOps Migration Specialist to lead the migration of our Azure DevOps services and resources from an on-premises environment to the Azure cloud platform. Key Responsibilities:
Evaluate current on-premises Azure DevOps setup and identify components for migration.

Ensure security, compliance, and best practices are followed throughout the migration process.
Provide documentation, training, and support to internal teams post-migration.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Demonstrable experience in Azure DevOps tools and services.
Proven track record in migrating on-premises infrastructure to the Azure cloud.
Expertise in designing, implementing, and optimizing cloud-based solutions.
Strong understanding of DevOps principles, CI/CD pipelines, and version control systems.
Certifications in Azure or related cloud technologies (preferred).

Familiarity with Agile methodologies and software development lifecycle.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a dynamic environment

Job Summary:
We are seeking a highly motivated individual to join our informatics team in furthering our research and outreach activities. The University of Wisconsin-Madison School of Medicine and Public Health (SMPH) is embarking on an exciting mission of establishing state of the art computational, data and informatics infrastructure for supporting cutting edge biomedical research and innovation to care. We are seeking a DevOps Engineer to join our Informatics team and help us design, develop, and deploy highly complex research computing and computational science workflows that support research. Under the direction of the Senior Director of Scientific Computing in the SMPH, the incumbent will build and work in the azure cloud environment and data enclave for research studies such as the Neighborhoods Study (https://grantome.com/grant/NIH/R01-AG070883-01) in the Center for Health Disparities Research (CHDR) program led by Dr. Amy Kind. CHDR focuses on understanding and eliminating health disparities and improving outcomes for vulnerable populations. We conduct multidisciplinary projects in clinical/health systems interventions, medical and public records assessment, and claims data analysis. The incumbent will develop, implement, and use azure cloud-based data enclave, computational methods for data integration, and data pipelining tools for facilitating the research projects.

Description:
Do you have a high degree of initiative and are always looking for the best solution for your team and customers? Are you accountable, self-motivated, and always driven to do better? Are you meticulous and business-focused? If so, we are seeking a talented and passionate DevOps Lead to join our team.
The DevOps Lead will be responsible for driving state-of-the-art automation and providing DevOps process leadership across the organization. You will act as a thought leader for development and operations tooling and processes, including creating, configure, and maintaining the frameworks, tools, and systems that enable optimal performance of the business’s sites and software. Come be a part of creating a culture of innovation, delivering first-in-class products!
Job Responsibilities:
The DevOps and Automation Lead will enable the business’s software engineering teams to build, test, and promote code effectively by providing DevOps pipeline best practices and corporate guidelines for tools and automated workflow capabilities. Lead the design and implementation of real-time monitoring systems of these sites/software. Promote, document, and implement systems infrastructure best practices, building tools that allow the department to develop and deploy impeccable sites/software. Work hand-in-hand with the front-end and back-end engineering teams in all technical operations and work to reduce or eliminate repetitive or manual tasks, improving health and performance issues .
Requirements:
Experience in automation, configuration, and application performance management tools such as MS Azure DevOps.
Experience in major cloud platforms, primarily AWS and Azure. AWS Certifications a plus.
6+ years of experience in a DevOps capacity within a fast-paced and fast-evolving environment.
Experience in CI/CD for scalable multi-tenant SaaS products in the cloud.
Hands-on experience ideally with EKS, K3S and tools like Keda, ArgoCD, S3, Azure Build Pipelines, code and container security scanning. Pen testing concepts and experience a plus.
Strong interpersonal and leadership skills, ability to coach and guide an international team
Ability to thrive under pressure and function effectively in a fast-paced environment, including balancing multiple priorities and dealing with ambiguity

About Us
Repario is an international, end-to-end eDiscovery service provider founded in 2023. Established via the merger of five established eDiscovery companies, each bringing their own expertise and specialty areas to our consolidated practice, Repario offers a comprehensive suite of services unmatched elsewhere in the industry. We provide expert digital forensics, incident response, and eDiscovery solutions focused primarily on the legal sector. We are a growing, entrepreneurial company seeking top-tier talent to help us provide exceptional value to our existing clients, while assisting in growing our market share and geographic footprint. We prioritize accuracy, security and timely delivery and are dedicated to providing our clients with the highest level of service and support.

Overview:
Paradyme Management is a rapidly growing government technology leader that puts service first, for its customers, its team and the communities it supports. Paradyme harnesses DevSecOps and Agile development processes to deliver exceptional results for digital transformations. With headquarters office in Tysons Corner, VA, Paradyme’s award-winning culture sets it apart through its team’s deep commitment to service and collaboration with its customers, each other and the community. Learn more at www.paradymemanagement.com.
Responsibilities:
The DevOps Engineer will design, develop, and provision docker image environments to support development teams. The ideal candidate is a hands-on experience in environment provisioning, with Kubernetes and Docker Images. They must have strong, firsthand technical expertise in a variety of configuration automation, deployment, and continuous integration technologies and the proven ability to fashion robust solutions that can keep pace with software development. They must be at ease working in an agile environment with little supervision. This person should embody a passion for continuous improvement and innovation.

The DevOps Engineer will lead a team responsible for the following:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with a team to deliver new software builds to the customer environment in a repeatable and reliable manner
Shepard software baselines through the stage, deploy, verify, monitor, and respond phases of a CI/CD pipeline
Stand up and/or work with the necessary tooling for a robust CI/CD pipeline, to include: Maven, Gitlab, Red Hat OpenShift, Docker, Ansible, and Puppet
Design, develops, test, debug, and deploy new software tools that extend or replace existing capabilities.
Write and update technical documentation such as system documentation, training materials, processes and procedures.
Collaborate cross-functionally with software engineers, data scientists, analyst, project managers and other engineering groups.
Provide ongoing maintenance, support, and enhancements in production systems and platforms.
Troubleshoots complex problems and provides customer support for software systems and application issues.
Provide recommendations for continuous improvement.
Work alongside other engineers on the team to sustain and advance our organization's capabilities.

Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree
Must be eligible to obtain US security clearance.
3+ years of experience with Kubernetes, Docker and Terraform.
Demonstrated hands on experience with AWS
Ability to create workflows, activities, and automation needed to shepherd a new piece of functionality from ideation to an on-demand release to the end user in a production environment
Demonstrated hands-on experience with Linux-based systems and shell scripting
Demonstrated hands-on experience with build automation technologies like Git, Maven, etc.
Demonstrated hands-on experience working with Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, and Elasticsearch.
Demonstrated experience deploying Docker engines in virtualized platforms for containerization of multiple apps
Demonstrated experience with GitHub
Demonstrated experience with Helm
Hybrid office support of two days in office and three days remote

Physical Requirements: These are the essential physical requirements needed to successfully perform the job.
Sedentary work.
Requires sitting up to 8 hours per day.
May require lifting up to 5 pounds unassisted.
Fine repetitive motor skills with hands, wrists, and fingers in coordination with eyes.
Hearing, speaking, and vision: Adequate to perform job duties and communicate in person, via video, and telephone. Includes reading information from printed sources and computer screens.
Other: Work may be performed in an office environment, which may involve frequent contact with staff and the public. Work may be stressful at times.
